instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 ripped vram pads
threads.message:
Have a 820-2915 that has the 216-0809000 GPU. Had typical GPU graphic problem. Replaced with NEW GPU from SEE-IC so no fake but had lines on a section of the screen and noticed piece of glue was stuck under the vram U8550. Tech accidentally pulled pad 152 and 153. These both seem important.

Wondering if it would be possible to move U8550 over to U8450 OR U8400 since there are no vrams soldered there on this board with the 216-0809000 GPU for a fix or is this board trashed now?

threads.title: 820-2915 ripped vram pads
threads.message:
You can still disable dGPU and let it work on iGPU only.
I think is better option than trash it...

threads.title: 820-2915 ripped vram pads
threads.message: Is there a way to modify the board to where I could use just one vram Samsung 256MB at U8500 in place of the two hynix 128mb vrams?
